issue.title: Gazebo does not start if the GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH enviromental variable is set

content.raw:
Just to clarify the original issue: I was not expecting that sourcing `/usr/(local/)share/gazebo/setup.sh` was necessary, because the default models (downloaded from the online database) are saved in `$HOME/.gazebo/models` (that is always searched for models: #!/osrf/gazebo/src/0d39ebf2b92ba1833f83ea14df668b50f89b5017/gazebo/common/SystemPaths.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#SystemPaths.cc-84), and there is no need for  gazebo plugins contained in the System Paths unless they are included in the model. 

However, given the current implementation of the SystemPaths handling, sourcing `/usr/(local/)share/gazebo/setup.sh` is the correct thing to do, and is properly documented in gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=components , so I think we can close the issue.
content.html:
Just to clarify the original issue: I was not expecting that sourcing /usr/(local/)share/gazebo/setup.sh was necessary, because the default models (downloaded from the online database) are saved in $HOME/.gazebo/models (that is always searched for models: #!/osrf/gazebo/src/0d39ebf2b92ba1833f83ea14df668b50f89b5017/gazebo/common/SystemPaths.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#SystemPaths.cc-84), and there is no need for gazebo plugins contained in the System Paths unless they are included in the model.

However, given the current implementation of the SystemPaths handling, sourcing /usr/(local/)share/gazebo/setup.sh is the correct thing to do, and is properly documented in gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=components , so I think we can close the issue.
